item.title: Bitcoin Weekly 2016 August 10: Bitfinex trading coming back online, App Store fake Bitcoin apps, Kim Dotcom Megaupload Bitcache talk
item.description:
Bitcoin Weekly 2016 August 10: Bitfinex trading coming back online, App Store fake Bitcoin apps, Kim Dotcom Megaupload Bitcache talk

Bitfinex is big news this week, especially after the hack last week, and the company has begun reporting that it expects to bring most of its trading platform back online along with deposits. The iTunes App Store is still having troubles with fake Bitcoin apps appearing-Apple has been removing those last discovered and reported but new ones have arrived recently.

item.title: Is it possible to create a blockchain from scratch using any high level language like python?
item.description:
Is it possible to create a blockchain from scratch using any high level language like python?

Answer: Yes. It's not even a particularly difficult task - although it may be quite demanding in the sense that it's something you would have to get exactly right. The difficult part was coming up with the idea. But Satoshi put it in the public domain, and once you know what you're aiming for, i...

item.title: Building The Bridge: Why Compliance Is Key To Digital Currency's Success - Stories From Coinbase
item.description:
Building The Bridge: Why Compliance Is Key To Digital Currency's Success - Stories From Coinbase

I occasionally see people in the digital currency industry question the value of compliance. By this I mean working with regulators, law enforcement, banks, etc. This isn't surprising given that many of the early adopters of bitcoin are privacy advocates, and much of the world of compliance is about knowing your customer.

item.title: Snowden tweets private key hash, then deletes it, why? * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
Snowden tweets private key hash, then deletes it, why? * /r/Bitcoin

Bitcoin is the currency of the Internet: a distributed, worldwide, decentralized digital money. Unlike traditional currencies such as dollars, bitcoins are issued and managed without any central authority whatsoever: there is no government, company, or bank in charge of Bitcoin. As such, it is more resistant to wild inflation and corrupt banks.

item.title: Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - Targets Achieved, Buy Dips More? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - Targets Achieved, Buy Dips More? - NEWSBTC

Ethereum price continued to gain traction against the US Dollar, and it looks like the idea of buying dips may still work in the short term. Ethereum price continued to gain traction against the US Dollar, and it looks like the idea of buying dips may still work in the short term.

item.title: The U.S. Government is Auctioning Off $1.6 Million in Illegal Bitcoins
item.description:
The U.S. Government is Auctioning Off $1.6 Million in Illegal Bitcoins

The U.S. Marshals service is auctioning off over $1.6 million of forfeited bitcoins in a one-day event on August 22. The huge chunk of digital currency mostly comes from the treasure troves of black market retailers like Silk Road, a dark web drug selling site. The auction, which runs online from 8 a.m.

item.title: Rubbish: Australia to regulate bitcoin under money laundering and counter-terrorism laws
item.description:
Rubbish: Australia to regulate bitcoin under money laundering and counter-terrorism laws

Australia will be one of the first countries to regulate bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies under the guise of anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism laws. The proposal comes following the release of a report from the Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Center (AUSTRAC) that argues that "electronic, online and new payment methods" are posing an emerging terrorism financing risk.

item.title: BTC-E May Be Vulnerable To A Funds Duplication Bug
item.description:
BTC-E May Be Vulnerable To A Funds Duplication Bug

In the light of the Bitfinex hack, other cryptocurrency exchanges are facing a lot of scrutiny right now. BTC-E is being targeted by some people who want to exploit the exchange and see if they can obtain free funds.
